Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] <ResolveAssemblies/> and ref assemblies" (#3053) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/3045

In VS 2019 16.1 Preview, a project using `Microsoft.Extensions.Http`
fails to build with:

    C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Preview\MSBuild\Xamarin\Android\Xamarin.Android.Common.targets(2146,5): error MSB4018: The "LinkAssemblies" task failed unexpectedly.
    System.IO.FileNotFoundException: Could not load assembly 'System.Runtime, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a'. Perhaps it doesn't exist in the Mono for Android profile?
        File name: 'System.Runtime.dll'
        at Java.Interop.Tools.Cecil.DirectoryAssemblyResolver.Resolve(AssemblyNameReference reference, ReaderParameters parameters)
        at Java.Interop.Tools.Cecil.DirectoryAssemblyResolver.Resolve(AssemblyNameReference reference)
        at Mono.Cecil.MetadataResolver.Resolve(TypeReference type)
        at Mono.Cecil.ModuleDefinition.Resolve(TypeReference type)
        at Mono.Cecil.TypeReference.Resolve()
        at Java.Interop.Tools.Cecil.TypeDefinitionRocks.<GetTypeAndBaseTypes>d__1.MoveNext()
        at System.Linq.Enumerable.Any[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source, Func`2 predicate)
        at Java.Interop.Tools.Cecil.TypeDefinitionRocks.IsSubclassOf(TypeDefinition type, String typeName)
        at MonoDroid.Tuner.FixAbstractMethodsStep.ProcessAssembly(AssemblyDefinition assembly)
        at Mono.Linker.Steps.BaseStep.Process(LinkContext context)
        at Mono.Linker.Pipeline.Process(LinkContext context)
        at MonoDroid.Tuner.Linker.Process(LinkerOptions options, ILogger logger, LinkContext& context)
        at Xamarin.Android.Tasks.LinkAssemblies.Execute(DirectoryAssemblyResolver res)
        at Xamarin.Android.Tasks.LinkAssemblies.Execute()
        at Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.TaskExecutionHost.Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.ITaskExecutionHost.Execute()
        at Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.TaskBuilder.<ExecuteInstantiatedTask>d__26.MoveNext() [C:\Temp\ResolveAssembliesSystemRuntime\AndroidApp1\AndroidApp1.csproj]

The problem being, that the `<ResolveAssemblies/>` MSBuild task didn't
return `System.Runtime.dll` in `@(ResolvedAssemblies)`.

What further complicated matters, was that the same project was
working with latest xamarin-android/master (16.2)? I was only able to
reproduce the problem in a test after some work to create a project
that only has a `<PackageReference/>` to `Microsoft.Extensions.Http`
with no other references *at all*. I had to do some MSBuild trickery
to remove `Java.Interop` and `System.Runtime` references.

Looking at the dependency tree in the failing test,
`System.Runtime.CompilerServices.Unsafe.dll` should be reporting a
reference to `System.Runtime.dll`. Through debugging, I saw it only
had a reference to `netstandard.dll`?

Then I realized there were two assemblies:

    ~\.nuget\packages\system.runtime.compilerservices.unsafe\4.5.1\ref\netstandard2.0\System.Runtime.CompilerServices.Unsafe.dll
    ~\.nuget\packages\system.runtime.compilerservices.unsafe\4.5.1\lib\netstandard2.0\System.Runtime.CompilerServices.Unsafe.dll

The "ref" assembly, references `netstandard.dll` and the "lib"
assembly (that we should be using) references `System.Runtime.dll`.

Through further debugging, I found two bugs here:

* We shouldn't call `resolver.AddSearchDirectory` until *after* we've
  checked if the top-level assembly is a reference assembly. We don't
  want a reference assembly in the search paths!
* `MetadataResolver` should key its cache on the resolved path to the
  assembly. This allows `<ResolveAssemblies/>` to open two *different*
  instances of `System.Runtime.CompilerServices.Unsafe`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Bump to xamarin/xamarin-android-api-compatibility/master@670cc5e5" (#3052) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://jenkins.mono-project.com/view/Xamarin.Android/job/xamarin-android/499/API_20Compatibility_20Checks

As mentioned in commit 679f95cd, there is some reported API breakage
which requires updating our reference API descriptions, e.g.
acceptable type removals such as
`System.Runtime.InteropServices._Type` and the removal of some
`virtual` method overrides in `System.IO.DirectoryInfo.Exists`.

Update external/xamarin-android-api-compatibility so that we don't
generate errors for these reviewed-and-accepted changes.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[WIP] Xamarin.Android build preparation utility" (#3051) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Testing:

 * Default mode: run `build-tools/xabootstrap/run.sh`
 * Verbose debug: run `build-tools/xabootstrap/run.sh -v:d`
 * Help: run `build-tools/xabootstrap/run.sh -h`

This commit implements a `make prepare` replacement that does not rely on shell
scripts or MSBuild. The idea is that a standalone C# program can perform all the
steps in a more streamlined, more clear way than the current solution. One of
the main goals is to make the process more approachable by external
contributors, but also by the core developers who may want to change some
aspects of XA build preparation (e.g. Android platforms, Mono version etc) but
are not familiar with the build system. Towards that goal, the codebase is
designed so that the minimum amount of searching around it is necessary to
figure out where to make the desired change. Main location serving this purpose
is the `build-tools/xabootstrap/xabootstrap/ConfigAndData` directory. It should
be the *only* location where one needs to look in order to change all and any
aspects of XA preparation.

[TBC]

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Target Android version 9 missing + uses sdk build tools 27 instead of 28 (vs2019)" (#2994) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

Create a default native android app using Xamarin.
Open android project properties on the manifest editor
Try to set Target Android version to 9. You can't.
Open AndroidManifest.xml using a text editor and add:
```
	<uses-sdk android:minSdkVersion="25" android:targetSdkVersion="28" />
```
Build
If you only have build tools v28+ installed, VS will stop building with an error "install build tools v27".

### Expected Behavior

Uses build tools v28

### Actual Behavior

VS stop building with an error:
```
Project 'Test.Droid' requires the following components installed on your machine: 
Android SDK Build-Tools 27.0.3
```

### Version Information

[version.txt](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/3088182/version.txt)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[AAPT2] first styleable resource id is always incorrect" (#3049) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new android project. Android Options: 
- shared runtime + fast deployment
- multi dex on
- dex compiler d8
- code shrinker proguard (i'm unable to run any app when using r8 even in debug mode)
- enable debugger
- use concurrent garbage collector
- linking none
- compile with android 9
2. Create a simple android custom control, add a styleable android resource, and use the custom control in the android layout, specifying one of the styleable resource in its attributes.
```xml
Ex using the custom "MvxBind" styleable attribute.

        <TextView
            app:MvxBind="VisibilityNoAnim InvertedBool(IsInternetAvailable)"
            android:layout_width="match_parent"
            android:layout_height="wrap_content"
            android:text="InternetDisconnected"
 />
```
3. Compile and debug

```xml
<resources>
  <declare-styleable name="MvxImageView2">
    <attr name="throttle" format="integer"/>
    <attr name="imageUrl" format="string"/>
    <attr name="imageViewTraceEnabled" format="boolean"/>
    <attr name="throttleSvg" format="string"/>
  </declare-styleable>
</resources>
```

```csharp
        using R = ReproApp.Resource;

...

        [Android.Runtime.Preserve]
        public MvxImageView2(Context context, IAttributeSet attrs, int defStyleAttr, int defStyleRes) : base(context, attrs, defStyleAttr, defStyleRes)
        {
            if (attrs != null)
            {
                using (var a = context.ObtainStyledAttributes(attrs, R.Styleable.MvxImageView2, defStyleAttr, defStyleRes))
                {
                    TraceEnabled = a.GetBoolean(R.Styleable.MvxImageView2_imageViewTraceEnabled, TraceEnabled);
                    ImageLoadThrottleMilliseconds = a.GetInt(R.Styleable.MvxImageView2_throttle, ImageLoadThrottleMilliseconds);
                    ImageUrl = a.GetString(R.Styleable.MvxImageView2_imageUrl) ?? ImageUrl;
                    throttleSvg = a.GetString(R.Styleable.MvxImageView2_throttleSvg);
                    a.Recycle();
                }
            }
        }
```

### Expected Behavior

R.Styleable.MvxImageView2_imageViewTraceEnabled and all other constants except  R.Styleable.MvxImageView should have a value from between 0 and 3.

### Actual Behavior

All the custom styleable constants (except  R.Styleable.MvxImageView) have a value between 0 and 3 except one whose value is negative (if it was an uint, it would be over 2147483648).

Thus the constant is never found in the typedarray and the call crash the app with an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.

I have reproduce the issue with the custom attributes of mvvmcross, with XamSvg, and a custom image control.

The workaround is to disable AAPT2.

### Version Information

VS2019 16.1.0 preview 2

[versioninfo.txt](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/3132418/versioninfo.txt)

### Log File

```
04-30 11:50:11.080 19485 19485 I mono-stdout: (MvxBind) #1/L18:Error:java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: length=726; index=-100260048
04-30 11:50:11.080 19485 19485 I mono-stdout: (MvxBind) #1/L19:Error:   at android.content.res.TypedArray.getString(TypedArray.java:198)
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Bump to mono/mono/2019-02@d04d534d" (#3046) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] Make XA0115 error more actionable" (#2967) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://forums.xamarin.com/discussion/146174/vs2019-error-this-abi-is-no-longer-supported
Context: https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/comments/485766/view.html

Change the wording of the armeabi build error to make it more actionable
at the cost of also making it a bit longer.

In addition to the questions about this error from users on the forums
and Developer Community, another motivation for this change is that
compared to back when I added the original wording for this message, I
have now had more practice updating other error messages and thinking
about how to make them as actionable as possible on their own.

Unfortunately the correct action to take in the IDE in this case is a
little confusing because the property page in Visual Studio on Windows
is currently different from the property page in Visual Studio for Mac.
For example, in Visual Studio for Mac, the **Advanced** tab of the
**Android Build** page will show a checkbox for `armeabi` if that
setting is present in the `$(AndroidSupportedAbis)` property in the
`.csproj` file, so users can just un-check that option to remove the
`armeabi` value.  But on Windows, the **Advanced** modal window under
the **Android Options** page now *never* shows a checkbox for `armeabi`,
so the easiest way to remove the value is to change and change back one
of the other options and save the properties.  That rewrites
`$(AndroidSupportedAbis)` to contain only the values that are *shown* as
selected in the modal window.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "InputFilter placing buffer into dest" (#3034) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Compile the demo below. Type ASDFGhjkl
2. ASDFG shows in the edit text
3. Press delete. You will need to press delete 5 times before G is delete.

https://github.com/nodoid/edittext_error

### Expected Behavior
If ASDFG is being passed in dest, pressing delete once should remove G
### Actual Behavior
Delete needs to be pressed however many times after the last uppercase character there is an "illegal" entry

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "App Crashes on nested Shell section" (#4856) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
I do this test (```Xamarin.Forms 4.0.0.8055-pre1```):

```XAML
   <Shell.FlyoutHeader>
        <local:FlyoutHeader />
    </Shell.FlyoutHeader>

    <ShellItem Title="Home" Icon="home.png">
        <ShellSection>
            <ShellContent>
                <local:MainPage />
            </ShellContent>
        </ShellSection>
    </ShellItem>

    <ShellItem Title="Notifications" Icon="notification.png">
        <ShellSection>
            <ShellContent Title="Recent">
                <local:NotificationPage />
            </ShellContent>
        </ShellSection>
    </ShellItem>

    <ShellItem Title="Test" Icon="icon.png">
        <ShellSection Title="Home" Icon="home.png">
            <ShellContent>
                <local:MainPage />
            </ShellContent>
        </ShellSection>

        <ShellSection Title="Notifications" Icon="notification.png">
            <ShellContent Title="Recent">
                <local:NotificationPage />
            </ShellContent>

            <ShellContent Title="Settings">
                <local:SettingsPage />
            </ShellContent>
        </ShellSection>
    </ShellItem>
```
 All works when we tap the hamburger menu. 

### Steps to Reproduce
1. Go to ```Test``` menu and tap ```Home``` and ```Notifications``` back and forth.
2. Choose between ```Recent``` or ```Settings``` in ```Notifications```, the page will open respectively.
3. Then, when we tap the hamburger menu again, the app crashes.

### Expected Behavior
Should just open the hamburger menu and can select any menu.

### Actual Behavior
App crashes

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: **Xamarin.Forms 4.0.0.8055-pre1**
- Last known good version: N/A
- IDE: **VS2019 Preview-1**
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - **Android: 8.0 API 26 SDK**
- Affected Devices:
  - **Samsung Galaxy A5 SM-A520F**

### Screenshots
Before it crashes.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1063940/50411744-8e9a1280-083d-11e9-82d2-e93a7dbcecdc.png)


[Shell.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/2729158/Shell.zip)
Parent: #2415

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Shell] DisplayActionSheet " (#4762) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

Calling DisplayActionSheet on Android works fine, but on iOS crashes.

```
System.Reflection.TargetInvocationException: Exception has been thrown by the target of an invocation. ---> System.InvalidCastException: Specified cast is not valid.

--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
  at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.AsyncMethodBuilderCore+<>c.<ThrowAsync>b__6_0 (System.Object state) [0x00000] in /Library/Frameworks/Xamarin.iOS.framework/Versions/12.2.1.12/src/Xamarin.iOS/mcs/class/referencesource/mscorlib/system/runtime/compilerservices/AsyncMethodBuilder.cs:1023

  at (wrapper managed-to-native) UIKit.UIApplication.UIApplicationMain(int,string[],intptr,intptr)
```

Crash.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Android previewer issues and Visual Studio 2017 XAML formatting issues" (#4851) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

Please checkout the video
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OPjuBA0zlno&feature=youtu.be

The issues showed in the video are (in the same order I recorded in the video) :

1.  **After creating a project and building it, opening the previewer doesn't show the preview**. 
    In order to see the preview before starting my work, I have to do a small change just to trigger the preview.

2. Android previewer (iOS previewer seems to work): Setting **FontSize** is not reflected in the preview

3.  Android previewer (iOS previewer seems to work): Setting **RotationX/Y** is not reflected in the preview

4.  Very annoying and important: **Formatting the XAML** does not work.
    (I noticed that even if sometimes it works, it breaks after a while, the formatting just stops working. Trying to fix it by reopening the XAML and/or rebuilding the project doesn't work).

/cc @alanmcgovern @drewgillies 

### Steps to Reproduce

Please see the video 

### Expected Behavior

### Actual Behavior

### Basic Information

- Version with issue:
- Last known good version: `¯\_(ツ)_/¯`
- IDE: **Visual Studio 2017 Enterprise, v15.9.4**
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - Android: The default of the Xamarin Forms project template (Android 8.1)

### Screenshots

<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

### Reproduction Link

<!-- Please upload or provide a link to a reproduction case -->

> VS bug [#756305](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/756305)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Shell] Single page app throws exception" (#5858) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

The Shell spec says it's possible to create a single page Shell app as follows:

```
<Shell xmlns="http://xamarin.com/schemas/2014/forms"
       xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2009/xaml"
       xmlns:views="clr-namespace:Xaminals.Views"
       x:Class="Xaminals.AppShell"
       FlyoutBehavior="Disabled">
    <views:CatsPage />
</Shell>
```

However, this throws a `NullReferenceException` on Android, and a `InvalidOperationException` on iOS.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Run the attached sample.

### Expected Behavior

Single page app is displayed.

### Actual Behavior

`NullReferenceException` on Android, and a `InvalidOperationException` on iOS.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 4.0-pre8
- Last known good version: N/A
- IDE: VSMac 8.0
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - iOS: 12.1
  - Android: API 27 

### Reproduction Link

[Xaminals.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/3058722/Xaminals.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[iOS] Add missing null check to `SelectableItemsViewRenderer.SetupNewElement`." (#6057) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Missing null check in `SelectableItemsViewRenderer.SetupNewElement` causes an unhandled exception when the CollectionView's renderer is disposed. This change adds the null check and an automated test.

### Issues Resolved ### 

- fixes #5949 

### API Changes ###
 
 None

### Platforms Affected ### 

- iOS

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###

None

### Before/After Screenshots ### 

Not applicable

### Testing Procedure ###

Navigate to the test for Issue 5949 and follow the instructions.

### PR Checklist ###

- [x] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [x] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Enhancement] Previewer Platform choice design" (#5549) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
## Summary

Now the way to choose a platform in Previewer is as follows:
Platfrom:  Android   iOS
I propose to change it to:
Android    iOS
As of now to change the platform the developer need to extend the previewer unnecessarily. With this change the platform choice can be made without expanding previewer.
## API Changes

Only design Change

## Intended Use Case
This will make changing platform more accessible.

> VS bug [#820917](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/820917)

The app and the backend environment are way to complicated to do a "small repo" to demonstrate the issue.   The crash info is included below.

No crash

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[macOS, iOS] Label with multiline text shows single line after LineBreakMode change" (#6055) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

A Label is able to show multiline text, but sometimes it shows only the first line of the text.

In macOS when LineBreakMode is changed from the initial value NoWrap to WordWrap, then the Label shows the first line of the text. When the initial value of LineBreakMode is WordWrap, then changing its value to NoWrap and back does not change its appearance.

In iOS when LineBreakMode initial value is NoWrap, then the Label shows the first line of the text. Changing its value to NoWrap and back does not change its appearance.

The attached sample application reproduces the issue. There are two Labels with multiline text. Click "Change" to change the value of LineBreakMode of the Labels.


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Run the attached sample
2. Click "Change" many times
3. The first label changes in macOS and is always truncated in iOS

### Expected Behavior

A Label should not change.

### Actual Behavior

A Label changes.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 4.0.1.383393-nightly (macOS), 3.6.0.344457 (iOS)
- Last known good version:
- IDE: Visual Studio for Mac 8.0.4
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - Xamarin.iOS:  12.8
  - Xamarin.Mac: 5.8
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices: macOS Mojave (10.14.4), iPhone XR (12.2 - simulator)

### Screenshots

<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->
![bugLabel1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14055723/56993433-bd821580-6b9c-11e9-8ee0-cc445ebc8f15.png)

![bugLabel2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14055723/56993435-c1159c80-6b9c-11e9-893a-c0d2ba87892e.png)

![bugLabel-iOS](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14055723/56993438-c2df6000-6b9c-11e9-8499-fd0034bfd1aa.png)

### Reproduction Link

<!-- Please upload or provide a link to a reproduction case -->
[TestAppLabel.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/3133147/TestAppLabel.zip)
